intro: Lisianthius chimantensis, commonly known as the Chimanté lisianthus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Its flowers are usually bright yellow or orange, and it produces small, elongated fruits known as achenes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
